meanings.definition: The state of being in a dying or declining condition.
meanings.sent1: The moribundities of the old building were evident in its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent2: The hospital staff worked tirelessly to improve the moribundities of the patients.
meanings.sent3: Despite its moribundities, the plant still managed to bloom a beautiful flower.
meanings.sent4: The town's economy showed signs of moribundities, struggling to stay afloat.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the moribundities of nature in a poignant painting.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being near death or obsolescence.
meanings.sent1: The moribundities of the old technology were evident in its slow performance.
meanings.sent2: The company faced the challenge of overcoming the moribundities of its outdated business model.
meanings.sent3: The moribundities of the ancient artifact made it a sought-after item for collectors.
meanings.sent4: The once bustling street now showed signs of moribundities, with empty storefronts.
meanings.sent5: The writer's words painted a vivid picture of the moribundities of the dying town.
